New Records: Sri Lanka recorded their lowest T20 total - 77
South Africa became the third team after England and New Zealand to bowl 70 dot balls in a T20 World Cup innings
Ottneil Baartman became the first South Africa bowler to pick a wicket of his first delivery on T20 WC debut
Anrich Nortje records the most economical four-over spell by a pacer in T20 World Cup (4-0-8-4)
Nortje also joins Shakib Al Hasan and Saeed Ajmal for the joint-most four-wicket hauls in T20 WCs
Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 8 runs in his spell
South Africa bundled Sri Lanka for 77, their lowest T20 score
The Proteas then recorded a scrappy win, reaching the target with six wickets and under four overs to spare
Tristan Stubbs made his debut for South Africa in the match
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka won the toss and opted to bat first
South Africa's bowling coach Eric Simons expressed concerns about Anrich Nortje's form before the match
The match was played at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York
Post-Match Reflections: Aiden Markram praised the team's resilience and adaptability
Wanindu Hasaranga reflected on Sri Lanka's batting performance and expressed confidence in the team's bowling attack
Anrich Nortje expressed happiness with his performance and the team's win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by a sluggish outfield
There was a 40% chance of rainfall during the match
South Africa's predicted XI included key players like Quinton de Kock, Aiden Markram, and Anrich Nortje
Others: The match was part of Group D in the T20 World Cup 2024
